alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cabell; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 10:19PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Cabell, Kanawha, central Putnam, northeastern Lincoln, southwestern Roane, southwestern Clay, southeastern Jackson and northwestern Boone Counties through 1045 PM EST... At 1013 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Charleston, or near Charleston, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Winfield, Hamlin, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, Poca, East Bank, Glasgow, Pinch and Culloden. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 20. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 124. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 30 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 86 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 56 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Cabell; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam; Roane
